meanings.definition: A situation in which progress is impossible because two opposing forces are evenly matched.
meanings.sent1: The deadlock in the game was so intense that neither player could make a move.
meanings.sent2: The negotiation reached a deadlock when both parties refused to compromise.
meanings.sent3: The deadlock between the two teams was like a tug-of-war with no winner in sight.
meanings.sent4: The deadlock in the courtroom felt like a battle of wills with no end in sight.
meanings.sent5: The deadlock in the traffic jam seemed to freeze time itself.

meanings.definition: A standstill resulting from the opposition of two evenly matched forces.
meanings.sent1: The deadlock between the two boxers left the audience on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent2: The political deadlock in the parliament led to a delay in passing important laws.
meanings.sent3: The deadlock in the race was like watching a slow-motion replay in real life.
meanings.sent4: The deadlock between the rival companies felt like a never-ending game of chess.
meanings.sent5: The deadlock in the courtroom was as tense as a high-stakes poker game.
